FuncDef:
The ds-lite address-group command creates a DS-Lite address pool or displays the view of an existing DS-Lite address pool.
The undo ds-lite address-group command deletes a DS-Lite address pool.
No DS-Lite address pool is configured by default.
CLIs: undo ds-lite address-group <address-group-name> group-id <id> <start-address> { mask { <mask-length> | <address-mask> } | <end-address> } [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a DS-Lite public IP address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the ID of a DS-Lite public IP address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 127.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance to which a DS-Lite public address pool is bound.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies a start IP address in a DS-Lite public address pool.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of a DS-Lite public address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.

Specifies the mask of a DS-Lite public IP address pool.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an end IP address in a DS-Lite public address pool.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo: A DS-Lite address pool is a collection of public IPv4 addresses. When IPv4-in-IPv6 packets are sent to a DS-Lite device through a DS-Lite tunnel, they are first decapsulated into IPv4 packets with the source IP addresses set to private IPv4 addresses. To transmit IPv4 packets to a public network, a device performs DS-Lite to translate IP addresses carried in IPv4 packets. The DS-Lite address pool used in DS-Lite is determined by a traffic policy.
